character.statement: Hi, I'm the immuno- the immunopath- the, uh--
How did you know?
If I say no?
I'm in!
What do we do?
Why don't we just tell him he's sick and ask him to come in for testing?
So what do we do?
Here's the photo.
Can I borrow the ship again? There's this sick dog outside that I need to help.
Well, the dog ate something with your logo on it.
What does that mean?
I should bring this to Dr. Lange.
I already showed the photo to Dr. Lange.
Finally, some reinforcements!
We've been working around the clock.
It's nice of Dr. Lange to let you off the hook about the fake ID badge.
With that said, you'd best get to work.
If you are looking for Dr. Lange, she's in the back room with the device.
You're quite the virus hunter.
You must be the immunopathologist we've been waiting for.
Go check in with Dr. Lange, our project lead.
Hmm, your badge looked real to me.
Then again, my glasses are kind of foggy.
Dr. Lange is waiting for you in the back room.
Get there through the door behind you.
Nice work. You're a natural.
Oh please. I can spot a phony ID badge from a mile away.
Your badge is written in crayon.
But today's your lucky day.
It just so happens that I'm in need of a volunteer--
someone brave and maybe a little reckless.
How does 5 to 10 in a federal penitentiary strike you?
This briefing will tell you what we're up against.
That brings us up to date.
Someone in this town is carrying a new virus -- a "super bug" capable of causing a global outbreak.
We need to find out who this person is.
We know some facts about them. Take this dossier.
When you find this person – this Patient Zero – do not engage them in any way.
Take their picture and come straight back here.
Here, you'll also need this.
What are you still doing here?
Find Patient Zero - lives depend on it.
Here's our Patient Zero: Joe Stockman.
Joe is asymptomatic.
He doesn't know it, but he carries the disease – and that means he can spread it.
Too risky. He could panic and do something irrational.
Our best shot at finding a cure is to keep him calm and unaware.
We ride the cutting edge of medical science.
Come with me.
Pfft. We can't use our secret, multi-billion-dollar tech on a house pet. What's it got to do with us?
Oh no, our weaponized heartworm! That canine is now a ticking timebomb.
There's no time to waste. You've got to defeat the heartworm before it spreads. Contain the dog.
Go down the elevator and talk to Dr. Lange.
I wish they'd let me ride the ship.
